page.title: 07Newcastle central; Hospitals
page.content: The city centre of Newcastle upon Tyne is well served by health facilities. As well as 5 hospitals, there are many clinics and doctor's surgeries. The city's main hospital is the {Royal Victoria Infirmary}with a large radiography department, also famous for dermatology.It is a major casualty hospital, having the region's only landing pad for helicopters.{ { The Fleming Hospital}is a specialist children's hospital with a major psychiatric department. The{"Princess {Mary"}is the area's maternity hospital, whereas Newcastle's only private hospital is the{Nuffield.} The city centre{dental hospital}was replaced by a new building, used as a teaching centre for local students, there being a strong regional tradition of{medical teaching.
